metadata.Title: CVE-2016-2074 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - low.
metadata.Description:
Buffer overflow in lib/flow.c in ovs-vswitchd in Open vSwitch 2.2.x and 2.3.x before 2.3.3 and 2.4.x before 2.4.1 allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via crafted MPLS packets, as demonstrated by a long string in an ovs-appctl command.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-2074` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

openvswitch-common - 2.5.0-0ubuntu1
openvswitch-ipsec - 2.5.0-0ubuntu1
openvswitch-pki - 2.5.0-0ubuntu1
openvswitch-switch - 2.5.0-0ubuntu1
openvswitch-switch-dpdk - 2.5.0-0ubuntu1
openvswitch-test - 2.5.0-0ubuntu1
openvswitch-testcontroller - 2.5.0-0ubuntu1
openvswitch-vtep - 2.5.0-0ubuntu1
ovn-central - 2.5.0-0ubuntu1
ovn-common - 2.5.0-0ubuntu1
ovn-host - 2.5.0-0ubuntu1
python-openvswitch - 2.5.0-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

notes.Note: mdeslaur> in 2.4, is a DoS only, and only if debug logging is enabled

criterions.comment: openvswitch package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.5.0-0ubuntu1').
